page.title: 13OLD WATER TOWER REDDITCH
page.content: When the first reservoir was built at Headless Cross in about 1882, a water tower was also built on the same piece of land and is called the {"Old {Headless Cross Water Tower" }. It was built in red brick in an octagnal shape.It has a weather vane on the roof.It was built solely to supply the high level "Ridgeway" area with water. It had a capacity of 20,000 gallons. The tower consisted of a wrought iron tank enclosed in the tower, which had a slated roof. The{"Old Headless Cross {Water Tower"}worked satisfactorily until the late 1950s, when an inspection of the tower revealed that it was in very poor condition.It was decided that a new water tower should be built and from then on no water was stored in it,but it still remains an important landmark in 1985.
